Song.title: Gethsemane Hymn
Song.copyright: Keith Getty | Stuart Townend © 2008 Thankyou Music (Admin. by Capitol CMG Publishing)

Arrangement.text:
Verse 1: To [Bm]see the [F#m/A]King of h[Em/G]eaven [Bm/F#]fall In a[Em7]nguish [F#m7] to His k[B5]nees The L[Bm]ight and [F#m/A]Hope of [Em/G]all the [Bm/F#]world Now [Em7]overw[F#m7]helmed with g[B5]rief What n[D]ame[A/C#]less ho[Bm]rrors [Em/G]must He [F#m/A]see To c[D]ry [A/C#]out [Bm]in the [Em/G]gar[F#m/A]den Oh [Bm]take [F#m/A]this [Gmaj7]cup [Bm/F#]a[Em7]way [F#m7]from [G2]Me [G] Yet [Em7]not My [F#m7]will but Y[G2]ours [G] Yet [Em7]not My [F#m7]will but Y[B5]ours
Verse 2: To [Bm]know each [F#m/A]friend will [Em/G]fall a[Bm/F#]way And h[Em7]eaven's [F#m7]voice be s[B5]till For [Bm]hell to [F#m/A]have its v[Em/G]engeful [Bm/F#]day Up[Em7]on Gol[F#m7]gotha's h[B5]ill No w[D]ords [A/C#]des[Bm]cribe the S[Em/G]aviour's [F#m/A]plight To [D]be [A/C#]by [Bm]God for[Em/G]sak[F#m/A]en Till w[Bm]rath [F#m/A]and [Gmaj7]love [Bm/F#]are [Em7]sat[F#m7]isf[G2]ied [G] And e[Em7]very [F#m7]sin is p[G2]aid [G] And e[Em7]very [F#m7]sin is p[Bm]aid
{new_page} Verse 3: What [Bm]took Him [F#m/A]to this w[Em/G]retched [Bm/F#]place What [Em7]kept Him [F#m7]on this r[B5]oad His [Bm]love for [F#m/A]Adam's [Em/G]curséd [Bm/F#]race For [Em7]every b[F#m7]roken s[B5]oul No [D]sin [A/C#]too s[Bm]light to [Em/G]over[F#m/A]look No cr[D]ime [A/C#]too g[Bm]reat to [Em/G]car[F#m/A]ry All [Bm]min[F#m/A]gled [Gmaj7]in [Bm/F#]this [Em7]poi[F#m7]soned [G2]cup [G] And [Em7]yet He [F#m7]drank it [G2]all [G] The S[Em7]aviour [F#m7]drank it [G2]all [G] The S[Em7]aviour [F#m7]drank it [B5]all
Arrangement.searchtext: verse 1 to see the king of heaven fall in anguish to his knees the light and hope of all the world now overwhelmed with grief what nameless horrors must he see to cry out in the garden oh take this cup away from me yet not my will but yours yet not my will but yours verse 2 to know each friend will fall away and heavens voice be still for hell to have its vengeful day upon golgothas hill no words describe the saviours plight to be by god forsaken till wrath and love are satisfied and every sin is paid and every sin is paid verse 3 what took him to this wretched place what kept him on this road his love for adams curséd race for every broken soul no sin too slight to overlook no crime too great to carry all mingled in this poisoned cup and yet he drank it all the saviour drank it all the saviour drank it all
